job_title: New College Grad - Semiconductor Verification Design Engineer, DRAM Products Group
job_description:
• New College Grad - Semiconductor Design Engineer, DRAM Products GroupBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 6 days ago New College Grad - Semiconductor Design Engineer, DRAM Products GroupBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 7 days ago New College Grad - Verification Enablement, Test Structure Design and LayoutTlaquepaque, Jalisco, MexicoPosted a month ago New College Grad - CAD/Computer Engineer, Central EngineeringBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 2 months ago Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts.
• Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering.
• Experience in memory circuit design and performance optimization.
• New College Grad - DRAM Design Verification EngineerTlaquepaque, Jalisco, MexicoPosted 2 months ago Demonstrated motivation to expand technical breadth and depth within collaborative global teams.
• Familiarity with RTL, Static Timing Analysis (STA), Python, and HSPICE.

• Core Skills: Strong analytical, organizational, and problem‑solving skills with the ability to handle multiple priorities.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to lead meetings and present data to large groups.
• Industry Experience: 3+ years of experience working in change management for semiconductor manufacturing environments or with fab‑related systems.
• MES Expertise: Experience with MES applications, Traveler Control, Process Control, or manufacturing system configuration.
• Process & Quality Systems: Experience supporting QMS, business process governance, or controlled change management.
• Experience: 2+ years of related experience in change management Education: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or a related field Less than 2 years Global Quality Process Control System (PCS) Senior EngineerTaichung City, Taichung City, Taiwan + 2 morePosted 5 months ago Senior Photolithography Process EngineerBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 11 days ago.
• Lead or contribute to local and global initiatives that improve MES system performance, consistency, and usability.
